description: Are you up for the toughest AI challenges around graph neural networks? We have built a graph-based patent search engine with which our users find the documents that already contain their concepts. We are looking for an Machine Learning Engineer who can envision breakthrough-level ideas and follow them through with software engineering excellence. You will be working with the very core of the product - the search algorithm.We have converted 100M patent documents into 100M knowledge graphs, to compress the key information into simpler data for ML. It has been possible because of the semi-structured patent text. Patent documents also contain rich metadata like citations between documents, which are essentially labels for supervised training. All of this presents an opportunity to dive deeper into text understanding than even the LLMs from the tech giants.The current model we use is the Graph Transformer (read our blog about the graph transformer), so both the NLP transformers and the GNN models are relevant. We published a paper at the SIGIR 2023 conference about our general approach (read our paper).The daily work is done in a small hybrid team. Remote work is okay, but we expect to see each other at least once a quarter in person. There is also a separate team providing MLOps support.Technology stackPyTorch for search model developmentML services deployed as Python microservicesGoogle Cloud for computationRequirementsExcellence in applied deep learning, ideally also with GNNsA genuine eagerness to learnKnowledge about NLPStrong social skillsFluency in English, which is our company languageYou are located ideally in Finland, but at least you can work in European time zonesBenefitsA rare opportunity to join an early-stage, disruptive company that has a unique edge, ambitious plans, and an already proven record of success in a growing $2bn industryOpportunities to grow as we grow. We will help you be the best you can be in this role, and help you develop skills that will help you reach the next stage. You will work with a highly talented and supportive teamA compelling and competitive financial package and other benefits, including six weeks of holidayIn Finland, other benefits include for example lunch, sports and culture, and commuting benefits, extended occupational health care with dental care, and tools of your choosingNext stepsOur recruitment process consists ofA casual interview with our AI Team Lead Sebastian and Head of People and Talent Mari, in which we will discuss your background and check if our wishes align with yoursWe would like to see an example of your code. You can share your Github profile with us or do a code task if that’s what you preferA technical interview with Sebastian and an AI team member to dig deeper into your technical skillsA final call with our CTO JuhoSounds interesting? Send us an application now!About IPRallyIPRally will change the way of finding and categorizing patents. How? We have introduced transparent and reliable AI applications to the patent search, analysis, and classification process, which helps our customers save a lot of time, resources, and money. We are transforming the complex and tedious process of finding information that is crucial for our customers, but most importantly, we help innovative companies quickly find and act upon opportunities and drastically reduce risk.So, who are we? IPRally was founded in Helsinki, Finland in 2018. With a vision to automate tasks that steal resources from both inventors and patent professionals and help them achieve their goals faster, a completely new and ground-breaking way of searching for technical information was built. By modeling the technical content of patents, and processing this with cutting-edge, proprietary graph neural networks, IPRally gives customers highly relevant information at their fingertips, in seconds.

job-title: Doctoral Researcher and Postdoctoral Researcher, Context-awareness for generative AI
description: Faculty of Science invites applications forPhD and Postdoc Positions in Context-awareness for generative AIRESEARCH PROGRAMThe aim of the research is to model the user’s context from data (behavior, conversations, physiology) for personalising generative AI applications such as an LLMs chatbot. We previously modeled user’s context to improve recommender systems (Jacucci et al. 2021 https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3458919 ) by computer screen monitoring. It is beneficial if the candidate has experience in computing human sensors signals, ubiquitous data collection , developing logging and monitoring applications. Background in Computer Science or related computational fields. The appointee for the doctoral researcher position must either already have the right to pursue a doctoral degree at the University of Helsinki by the start of the appointment or apply for the right and obtain it within the probationary period of 6 months applied in the appointment. If the appointee does not already have the right to pursue a doctoral degree at the University of Helsinki, the appointee must apply for it separately after being selected for the position ( https://www.helsinki.fi/en/research/doctoral-education/the-application-process-in-a-nutshell#section-3078 ).The appointee for the postdoc position needs to have a doctoral degree.The degree requirement must be met by the beginning of the employment.SALARY AND CONTRACT TERMSThe expected salary for Ph.D. candidate is about 2400-3000 € and for postdocs about 2800-3800 € , depending on qualifications and experience. The salary will increase with responsibilities and performance. The contract includes occupational health and social security benefits. P lease note that the positions will be filled once we have found suitable canditates so please leave your application asap if you are interested. The University of Helsinki reserves the right for justified reasons to leave the position open, to extend the application period, and to consider candidates who have not applied during the application period.LIVING IN FINLANDThe Helsinki Metropolitan area forms a world-class information technology hub, attracting leading scientists and researchers in various fields of ICT and related disciplines. Moreover, as the birthplace of Linux, and the home base of Nokia/Alcatel-Lucent/Bell Labs, F-Secure, Rovio, Supercell, Slush (the biggest annual startup event in Europe) and numerous other technologies and innovations, Helsinki is fast becoming one of the leading technology startup hubs in Europe. description: Aalto University is where science and art meet technology and business. We shape a sustainable future by making research breakthroughs in and across our disciplines, sparking the game changers of tomorrow and creating novel solutions to major global challenges. Our community is made up of 13 000 students, 400 professors and close to 4 500 other faculty and staff working on our dynamic campus in Espoo, Greater Helsinki, Finland. Diversity is part of who we are, and we actively work to ensure our community’s diversity and inclusiveness. This is why we warmly encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to join our community.Aalto University School of Engineering is now looking for an ambitiousPostdoctoral Researcher in Machine Learning for Non-destructive Testingto come and change the world of NDE with us.The use of machine learning in automated data analysis for non-destructive testing has started a revolution in how we work with inspection data. Recent research has shown, that machine learning models can reach human-level performance in data evaluation. This opens the door to next generation methods developed from the beginning to be integrated with machine learning. We invite you to apply for postdoctoral position at the Department of Mechanical Engineering.In the reseach project “Machine learning powered NDT”, we are working to enable new kind of NDE that uses AI/ML to seamlessly fuse data from different NDE modalities and to effectively evaluate data too voluminous for human inspectors.Your role and goalsYou’ll be driving this reseach and supporting doctoral students in the project. To succeed, you’ll need some background in both NDE and machine learning. You’ll need practical experience in tuning and training machine learning models with Python and Tensorflow or Pytorch. You’ll need a hands-on attitude, ready to go and acquire the data yourself, if need be.Your network and teamYou’ll work closely with Prof. (adjunct) Iikka Virkkunen and the staff in the Materials to Products group. Additional collaboration is planned with TWI (UK), BAM (Germany), and Nova School of Science and Technology (Portugal).Your Experience And AmbitionsThe applicant needs to have an Doctoral degree. Good skills in English, writing and oral, are needed.The ideal background for this research would include:Experience on NDE, especially ultrasonics and digital radiographyFamiliarity with modern NDE data reconstruction algorithms (FMC, PWI, TFM)Practical experience on training and testing machine learning modelsProficiency with Python, in particular in connection with data-manipulation of high-dimensional dataExperience with modern annotation tools like CVAT, NapariThe working language of the project will be English.It’s not just about machine learning. It’s not just about NDE. It’s about leveraging modern machine learning tools to create the future of NDE.What We OfferThe group at Aalto is in the vanguard of the young field of machine learning in NDE with tight industry connections multiple industry-first advances. job-title: Doctoral Researcher and Postdoctoral Researcher, Context-awareness for generative AI
description: Faculty of Science invites applications forPhD and Postdoc Positions in Context-awareness for generative AIRESEARCH PROGRAMThe aim of the research is to model the user’s context from data (behavior, conversations, physiology) for personalising generative AI applications such as an LLMs chatbot. We previously modeled user’s context to improve recommender systems (Jacucci et al. 2021 https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3458919 ) by computer screen monitoring. The new research will use in addition a variety of sensors to capture the physical world interactions in addition to the digital context and allow generative AI applications to access information of the current or past context of users.RequirementsKnowledge of machine learning for user modeling, generative, or conversational AI. It is beneficial if the candidate has experience in computing human sensors signals, ubiquitous data collection , developing logging and monitoring applications. Background in Computer Science or related computational fields. The appointee for the doctoral researcher position must either already have the right to pursue a doctoral degree at the University of Helsinki by the start of the appointment or apply for the right and obtain it within the probationary period of 6 months applied in the appointment. If the appointee does not already have the right to pursue a doctoral degree at the University of Helsinki, the appointee must apply for it separately after being selected for the position ( https://www.helsinki.fi/en/research/doctoral-education/the-application-process-in-a-nutshell#section-3078 ).The appointee for the postdoc position needs to have a doctoral degree.The degree requirement must be met by the beginning of the employment.SALARY AND CONTRACT TERMSThe expected salary for Ph.D. candidate is about 2400-3000 € and for postdocs about 2800-3800 € , depending on qualifications and experience. The salary will increase with responsibilities and performance. The contract includes occupational health and social security benefits. The starting date is negotiable.APPLICATIONSApply by submitting CV  cover letter describing research interests and preferred starting date  maximum three representative publications as PDFs  course transcripts from previous degrees (with grades)  contact information for two referees The applications for the position are to be submitted through the University recruitment system (link 'Apply now') for the first cut-off date 20th of August, the position will remain open afterward until filled and no later than the 31st of October. P lease note that the positions will be filled once we have found suitable canditates so please leave your application asap if you are interested. The University of Helsinki reserves the right for justified reasons to leave the position open, to extend the application period, and to consider candidates who have not applied during the application period.LIVING IN FINLANDThe Helsinki Metropolitan area forms a world-class information technology hub, attracting leading scientists and researchers in various fields of ICT and related disciplines. Moreover, as the birthplace of Linux, and the home base of Nokia/Alcatel-Lucent/Bell Labs, F-Secure, Rovio, Supercell, Slush (the biggest annual startup event in Europe) and numerous other technologies and innovations, Helsinki is fast becoming one of the leading technology startup hubs in Europe. See more e.g. at http://www.investinfinland.fi/ . The University of Helsinki welcomes applicants from a variety of gender identities, linguistic and cultural backgrounds . As a living and working environment, Finland consistently ranks high in quality-of-life. For more information about living in Finland: https://www.helsinki.fi/en/about-us/careers/why-finlandFor further information about the positions, please contact Professor Giulio Jacucci, giulio.jacucci(at)helsinki.fi.In case you need support with the recruitment system, please contact HR Specialist Laura Karppinen, laura.karppinen(at)helsinki.fi.
